bug.short_desc: Insufficient error message when code is tokenized

long_desc.thetext:
I had the following syntax error in my code:
myFunction("foo" + x + "bar" + y");
When I have called ./generate.py source, the following output was produced:
./generate.py source
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- Initializing: myapp ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- >>> Processing configuration
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- Executing: source::source-script ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- >>> Scanning libraries \Unable to tokenize text starting with: "); } } });"
With --verbose I could find out which file was affected.
Please print at least the file (and line number) in the normal output.
*** Bug 5421 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Syntax exceptions from the tokenizer are now also augmented with file name and line number.
